page.title: 11 Sedges Farm
page.content: There are all sorts of farms in this area;some dairy farms,a few sheep farms and some arable. Mr.Kyle owns Sedges Farm which is over five hundred years old. It has 180 acres and he also has 60 acres of woodland and he rents 12 acres. He is a sheep farmer so his fields are all grassland to provide food for the sheep. Mr.Kyle does not employ anybody full-time,but has some part time employees. He is helped by his wife and three children. He keeps four hens and two ducks,but he does not sell the eggs.The farm has 380 ewes which produce about 680 lambs per year. The lambs are sold for meat and the ewes are kept for wool which is worth Â£1,400. Each year Mr.Kyle spends Â£8,500 on food for the animals and Â£5,000 on silage.
